titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King, Nancy Lyon, and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:54

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of reports, speeches, and printed material relating to the history of Lesotho and the current political, economic, and social conditions. Photographs are also included.

langmaterial.language: The material is in English and Sotho.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lesotho Collection (MS 1524). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection (MS 605); Pamphlet Collection (MS 1351); African Postcard Collection (MS 1575). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in the original accession is arranged chronologically. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of reports, speeches, and printed material relating to the history of Lesotho and the current political, economic, and social conditions. Photographs are also included.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Lesotho - the Politics of Dependence , by J. E. Spence

Rural and urban development and environmental concerns

Lesotho National Development Corporation: journals, newsletters, portfolios
Transformation Resource Center: "Work for Justice"; news bulletins
"Puo Ea Motlotlehi Moshoeshoe II Mohla Letsatsi La Sesole-Maseru"
Origins and Growth of Maseru : report prepared by David Ambrose, National University of Lesotho, for the Department of Lands, Surveys and Physical Planning
"Chronology of Important Events in the History ofMaseru": volume 3 and updates
Vernacular Lesotho press, description of: letter to Moore Crossey from David Ambrose at National University of Lesotho

Booklets [political parties: BNP, KBP, LCD, LPC, NIP, PFD, SDP]
Booklets [women, birth control, domestic violence, rape]
Miscellaneous [Maseru United Church history, Thaba Bosiu National Monument pamphlet]
Photographs [daily life, Pius XII College, historic cemetery, miscellaneous]
"Souvenir Album: 25 Choice Views of Basutoland, the Switzerland of South-Africa"
Committee for Action and Solidarity for Southern African Students (CASSAS), "The Vanguard," vol. 4
Ireland Aid Primary Schools Construction Project in Lesotho, "I Like My School...I Really Do"

Mohale Schools Health and Environment Club (SHE), "Rata Tikoloho Ea Hau Joalokaha U Ithata"
Office of the Ombudsman, "Special Report in the Matter of Complaints by the Resettled People Against the Lesotho Highlands Development Authority"
"Lesotho Privatisation and Private Sector Development Project"
"The Treasury Echo," vol.2, no. 4, vol. 4, nos. 1-3
UNICEF, "Children Have Rights Too" bilingual booklet

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged as received.
